Reviews.Title: Student that loves this productivity machine
Reviews.Author: Timothy John Weston "Nathan Weston"
Reviews.Content: I've had this laptop for two weeks now and so far it's been amazing.PROS:-Touchscreen's great, very snappy and responsive. Works well with windows 8-Windows 8 is really nice with the touchscreen, all the security and all the new features.-definitely worth the money, only 700 when I bought it-beats audio integration is good with the headphones, not so much with the speakerCONS:-Average display, really not that noticeably great but it isn't noticeably bad either. what you expect to get for the price.-Speakers aren't really that great, not for prolonged music listening, but work well.Overall, a great all around laptop for  students, workers and personal use.

Reviews.Title: HP
Reviews.Author: William F Caten
Reviews.Content: I love this touch screen laptop!! The only problem it has no optical device. It was easy enough to solve with the purchase of a NU Slim USB Multi DVD burner.I realized that I rarely need a optical drive but nice to have around when needed!!

Reviews.Title: Enjoying the Touch screen and Ultrabook experience
Reviews.Author: Slippy
Reviews.Content: The Laptop has been awesome. Had a hard time choosing between a nice tablet or a touch screen laptop. I love using Windows 8 (didn't take too long to figure out). My daughter loves the picture password and the touch screen has enabled my 3yr old son to navigate games without use of the mouse or keyboard.At times I still would love to be able to fold the screen all the way back (Yoga style) and making selections (opening links, folders, files...) with the touch screen doesn't always respond well. I've also had a couple times when the WiFi wasn't working even with a connection and good reception.Overall, I love it.

Reviews.Title: Product failed after three months
Reviews.Author: Jeff Krueger
Reviews.Content: In the middle of working on this ultrabook it turned off and never came back.  Calls to tech support were difficult (offshored support).  They insisted that the power brick failed. Unfortunately the ultrabook was fully charged and was not plugged in.  It would appear the motherboard has failed.  Does anyone wonder why the "PC" market is hurting?  It's not just tablets, or mobile, but quality and useability.  The overall product, when working, is very good.  Windows 8 is questionable as a useable operating system.  Develop something easy to use and compelling from a productivity standpoint and people will come (i.e., Apple).  The device is under warranty and HP will fix; why didn't I spend the extra money to get a MacBook!  Hey HP - high school students are paying attention and they might be your next set of customers...probably not.

Reviews.Title: HP Envy
Reviews.Author: Shawna
Reviews.Content: I have had this Ultrabook for a few months now and I love it! :) it does everything I need without any issues. I'm still getting use to the windows 8 but so far I love it!!***I will update this review if I come across ANY issues.

Reviews.Title: Very nice
Reviews.Author: Dave Abeleven
Reviews.Content: A very nice laptop...the touchscreen is very good, although you will have to get use o cleaning it frequently because of your fingerprints it leaves behind on the screen. It is a slim laptop..not to heavy and easy to carry around. It works great and reacts fast enough

Reviews.Title: Works great with Windows 8!
Reviews.Author: bronzefury
Reviews.Content: Very responsive touch screen.  Great keyboard.  We love it so far!  Will play with it a bit more so I'll update this review in a couple of weeks.

Reviews.Title: It meets my expectations
Reviews.Author: Ifeanyi Ugbene
Reviews.Content: It is light weighted, speedy, ultra thin, and super touch sensitive. The HD picture quality meets my every expectation. Love it.

Reviews.Title: Horrible all around
Reviews.Author: Mar
Reviews.Content: After wasting hours installing and setting up this computer, it had a major hardware failure within 3 days of use. Absolutely unacceptable. HP customer support was difficult to navigate to say the least. Am returning it for a full refund. And am going to buy a Mac Air.

Reviews.Title: it's ok
Reviews.Author: elena
Reviews.Content: cute notebook, found the 14" screen a bit too small for me and doesn't have CD/DVD drive, not for me

ProductInfo.Features:
14-inch QHD+ IPS Touchscreen (3200 x 1800)
4th Generation Intel Core i5-4200U (1.60 GHz, up to 2.60 GHz)
8GB DDR3L Memory / 500GB Hard Drive
Intel HD Graphics 4400 / Beats Audio / Free T-Mobile 4G (up to 200MB per month)
Windows 8.1 / up to 5 hrs Battery Life (Silver) (Note: no optical drive)
ProductInfo.Name: HP Envy Touchsmart Ultrabook - 14-inch Quad HD LED Display, Intel Core i5-4200U Processor, 8GB Memory, 500GB HDD, Beats Audio, Windows 8, Silver
